definition: enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery

sentences.english: The evening mists are hovering over the mountain village.
The mist-filled valley and flickering lights below looked strangely welcoming.
sentences.chinese: 薄霧籠罩的山谷和山下閃爍的燈光出奇地好看。

sentences.english: I will clothe the heavens with darkness, and will make sackcloth their covering.
sentences.chinese: 我可使黑暗籠罩諸天，使麻衣掩蔽天際。

sentences.english: When a thundercloud comes over the kite.
sentences.chinese: 當雷雨雲籠罩了風箏之後。

sentences.english: The city was encompassed with a thick fog.
sentences.chinese: 那座城市被濃霧籠罩着。

sentences.english: Slowly insidiously the fog of the everyday has returned to enshroud me.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢地，不知不覺地，日常的迷霧又回來籠罩了我。

sentences.english: There can be no gainsaying of the fact that racial injustice engulfs this community.
sentences.chinese: 無可置疑的事實是，種族不公平籠罩着該市黑人社區。

sentences.english: The future to many people in the United States is a landscape under a black cloud.
sentences.chinese: 在許多美國人看，未來是黑雲籠罩的景觀。

sentences.english: He tried to break through the cloud of gloom hanging over his roomates with a joke.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖講句笑話打破籠罩着同室朋友間的鬱悶氣氛。

sentences.english: But the true events of that day are shrouded in mystery.
sentences.chinese: 但當天的事件真相仍籠罩在神祕的氣氛之中。

sentences.english: That smoothness is due to a thick layer of dust blanketing the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 這平滑是由於一層厚厚的灰塵籠罩的景觀。

sentences.english: The threat of nuclear war is already hanging over us.
sentences.chinese: 核戰爭的威脅已經籠罩在我們的頭頂上。

sentences.english: His close-cropped beard lay like a shadow over his hollow cheeks .
sentences.chinese: 他剪短了的鬍鬚如同陰影般籠罩在他凹陷的臉頰上。

sentences.english: The towering cloud is circular. It is surrounded by hazy, gray-white smoke.
sentences.chinese: 堆起的雲團呈圓形，其被模糊的灰白色煙霧所籠罩。

sentences.english: The economy of influence that grips Washington has destroyed Congress's independence.
sentences.chinese: 如今，經濟的影響籠罩在華府，這影響了國會的獨立。

definition: to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
